com.biorecorder.edflib

Class EdfReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biorecorder.edflib.EdfReader

  • public class EdfReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Permit to read DataRecords from EDF or BDF file. The structure of DataRecords is described in the file header. EdfReader reads and recognizes the information from the file header and save it in special HeaderConfig object. After that it can correctly read data from the file.

    EDF/BDF files contains "row" digital (int) data but they can be converted to corresponding real physical floating point data on the base of header information (physical maximum and minimum and digital maximum and minimum specified for every channel (signal)). So we can "read" physical values if we wish - readPhysicalDataRecord(), readPhysicalSamples(int, int).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      EdfReader(java.io.File file)
      Creates EdfReader to read data from the file represented by the specified File object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EdfReader

        public EdfReader(java.io.File file)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 HeaderParsingException
        Creates EdfReader to read data from the file represented by the specified File object.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to be opened for reading
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file header can not be read
        HeaderParsingException - if the file header is not valid EDF/BDF file header

    • Method Detail

      • setDataRecordPosition

        public void setDataRecordPosition(int newPosition)
        Set the DataRecords position indicator to the given new position. The position is measured in DataRecords. Methods readDigitalDataRecord() and readPhysicalDataRecord() will start reading from the specified position.
        Parameters:
        newPosition - the new position, a non-negative integer counting the number of DataRecords from the beginning of the file

      • setSignalSamplePosition

        public void setSignalSamplePosition(int signalNumber,
                                    long newPosition)
        Set the sample position indicator of the given channel (signal) to the given new position. The position is measured in samples.

        Note that every signal has it's own independent sample position indicator and setSignalSamplePosition() affects only one of them. Methods readDigitalSamples(int, int) and readPhysicalSamples(int, int) will start reading samples belonging to a channel from the specified for that channel position.

        Parameters:
        signalNumber - channel (signal) number whose sample position we change
        newPosition - the new sample position, a non-negative integer counting the number of samples belonging to the specified channel from the beginning of the file

      • getDataRecordPosition

        public int getDataRecordPosition()
        Return the current DataRecord position. The position is measured in DataRecords.
        Returns:
        current DataRecord position, a non-negative integer counting the number of DataRecords from the beginning of the file

      • getSignalSamplePosition

        public long getSignalSamplePosition(int signalNumber)
        Return the current sample position of the given channel (signal). The position is measured in samples.
        Parameters:
        signalNumber - channel (signal) number whose position we want to get
        Returns:
        current sample position, a non-negative integer counting the number of samples belonging to the given channel from the beginning of the file

      • readDigitalDataRecord

        public int[] readDigitalDataRecord()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Read ONE DataRecord from the file starting from the specified DataRecord position. The DataRecords position indicator will be increased with 1. Return the "raw" digital (integer) values.
        Returns:
        array of "raw" digital values belonging to ONE DataRecord or null if the end of file has been reached or the rest of the file contains insufficient data to form entire data record
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file could not be read

      • readPhysicalDataRecord

        public double[] readPhysicalDataRecord()
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Read ONE DataRecord from the file starting from the specified DataRecord position. The DataRecords position indicator will be increased with 1. The values are converted to their physical (floating points) values e.g. microVolts, beats per minute, etc.
        Returns:
        array of real physical values belonging to ONE DataRecord or null if the end of file has been reached or the rest of the file contains insufficient data to form entire data record
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file could not be read

      • readDigitalSamples

        public int readDigitalSamples(int signalNumber,
                              int[] digArray,
                              int offset,
                              int numberOfSamples)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Read the given number of samples belonging to the given channel starting from the current sample position indicator. The values are the "raw" digital (integer) values. The sample position indicator of that channel will be increased with the amount of samples read. Read samples are saved in the specified array starting at the specified offset. Return the amount of samples read (this can be less than given numberOfSamples or zero!)
        Parameters:
        signalNumber - channel (signal) number whose samples must be read
        digArray - int array where read samples are saved
        offset - offset within the array at which saving starts
        numberOfSamples - number of samples to read
        Returns:
        the amount of samples read (this can be less than given numberOfSamples or zero!)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readDigitalSamples

        public int[] readDigitalSamples(int signalNumber,
                                int numberOfSamples)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Read the given number of samples belonging to the given channel starting from the current sample position indicator. The values are the "raw" digital (integer) values. The sample position indicator of that channel will be increased with the amount of samples read. Array with read digital samples will be returned (array length can be less than given numberOfSamples or zero!)
        Parameters:
        signalNumber - channel (signal) number whose samples must be read
        numberOfSamples - number of samples to read
        Returns:
        Array with read digital samples
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readPhysicalSamples

        public double[] readPhysicalSamples(int signalNumber,
                                    int numberOfSamples)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Read the given number of samples belonging to the given channel starting from the current sample position indicator. The values are converted to their physical (floating points) values e.g. microVolts, beats per minute, etc.. The sample position indicator of that channel will be increased with the amount of samples read. Array with read physical samples will be returned (array length can be less than given numberOfSamples or zero!)
        Parameters:
        signalNumber - channel (signal) number whose samples must be read
        numberOfSamples - number of samples to read
        Returns:
        Array with read physical samples
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getHeaderInfo

        public HeaderConfig getHeaderInfo()
        Return the information from the file header stored in the HeaderConfig object
        Returns:
        the object containing EDF/BDF header information

      • rewriteHeader

        public void rewriteHeader(HeaderConfig headerConfig)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        On the base of information from the given config object a new header will be created and rewritten to the file. Note that the number of channels (signals) could not be changed!
        Parameters:
        headerConfig - config object containing info for the new header
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getFileType

        public FileType getFileType()
        On the base of the file header information determines whether the file opened for reading is EDF or BDF file
        Returns:
        the file type: EDF or BDF

      • availableDataRecords

        public int availableDataRecords()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Get the number of DataRecords available for reading (from the current DataRecord position)
        Returns:
        number of available for reading DataRecords
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file could not be read

      • availableSignalSamples

        public long availableSignalSamples(int signalNumber)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Get the number of samples of the given channel (signal) available for reading (from the current sample position set for that signal)
        Returns:
        number of samples of the given signal available for reading
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file could not be read

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Close this EdfReader and releases any system resources associated with it. This method MUST be called after finishing reading DataRecords. Failing to do so will cause unnessesary memory usage and corrupted and incomplete data writing.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the reader can not be closed correctly
